active.translation[0].definitions[0].def: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities
active.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
My father always led a very active life.
a child with a very active imagination
active.translation[0].definitions[1].def: involved in an organization or activity and doing lots of practical things to achieve your aims
active.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He became politically active at college.
She took an active interest in local charities.
We’re taking active steps  (=doing practical things) to deal with the problem.
We maintain active links with other European universities.
Encourage students to take an active part in discussions.
take/play an active part/role in something
the importance of active participation by elderly people in the life of the community
He is an active member of the Labour Party.
The Bureau is active in promoting overseas investment.
active.translation[0].definitions[2].def: operating in a way that is normal or expected
active.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The virus is active even at low temperatures.
active.translation[0].definitions[4].def: an active volcano is likely to erupt (=explode) at any time
active.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: The volcano became active last year with a series of eruptions.
active.translation[0].definitions[5].def: an active verb or sentence has the person or thing doing the action as its subject. In ‘The boy kicked the ball’, the verb ‘kick’ is active
active.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: nicotine, the active ingredient in tobacco
active.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 1: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities
active.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He lived a full and active life.
Studies show that an active lifestyle can reduce your chance of developing heart disease.
A fit body is crucial if you want an active mind.
Some of the children have an overactive imagination.
We try to keep the patients active by taking them for a daily walk.
You need to become more physically active and eat less.
active.translation[0].note_box[1].headin: – Meaning 2: involved in an organization or activity and doing lots of practical things to achieve your aims
active.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: an active role
Most men play a less active role in family life than women.
an active part
Our members take an active part in fund-raising.
an active member
She became an active member of the Geological Society.
an active interest
As a teenager he began to take an active interest in politics.
active participation/involvement
Active participation in community life is important in small towns and villages.
The school encourages the active involvement of parents.
an active participant
The student must be an active participant in the learning process.
active support
He wrote the book with the active support of his wife, Pam.
an active supporter
The company is an active supporter of animal rights groups.
play an active role in something
Do you play an active role in your community?
take an active part in something
Most of the students take an active part in sports.
take active steps to do something
You should take active steps towards reducing stress.
take an active interest in something
Not many young people take an active interest in gardening.
politically active
As a student, he was politically active.
economically active
The proportion of men aged 65–69 who are economically active has decreased.
active.translation[2].definitions[0].def: if trading or a market is active, there is a lot of buying and selling
active.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Hong Kong shares advanced in active trading.
These markets are among the most active and volatile in the world.
Gold was active again today, with nearly 70,000 contracts changing hands.
active.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a company that is active is selling products or services
active.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The company has been active in Italy for more than 25 years.
active.translation[2].definitions[2].def: if someone is active in doing something, they do it
active.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: Foreign companies have been active in making friendly acquisitions.
active.translation[2].definitions[3].def: taking definite action rather than just giving advice or waiting to see what will happen
active.translation[2].definitions[3].exa: They are calling for active government intervention.
The company will begin an active asset sale program.
She wanted to take a more active role in the running of the company.
active.translation[2].definitions[4].def: actually employed in doing a job
active.translation[2].definitions[4].exa: They have looked at data on their active and retired employees’ medical records.
active.translation[2].definitions[5].def: an active bank account is being used
